shy.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: nervous and embarrassed about meeting and speaking to other people, especially people you do not know
shy.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: He was a quiet shy man.
As a teenager, I was painfully shy (=extremely shy).
Oh, have you gone all shy, Jenny?
She was very shy with strangers.
He was too shy to come and sit by me in class.
shy.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: unwilling to do something or get involved in something
shy.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Employees are urged not to be shy about reporting incidents of sexual harassment.
shy.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: used to say that someone does not like something and therefore tries to avoid it
shy.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Although publicity-shy, he recently agreed to be interviewed.
shy.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: shy animals get frightened easily and are unwilling to come near people
